Query: How to set proxy for wget?

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: SSH tunneling: Dynamic port forwarding (SOCKS proxy on localhost:9999)
Top-3 Similar Questions: au_583797: How to set a proxy for terminal?
au_143303: How do I set up a linux proxy for my mac
au_819879: How to set proxy via SSH
Top-3 Scripts:
au_583797: ssh -o ProxyCommand='socat - SOCKS4A:myproxy:%h:%p,socksuser=nobody' user@host

ssh -o ProxyCommand='socat - "SOCKS5:%h:%p|tcp:myproxy:1080"' user@host

ssh -o ProxyCommand='socat - "PROXY:%h:%p|tcp:myproxy:80"' user@host

Explanations about Options.-p:
Port to connect to on the remote host. This can be specified on a per-host basis in
 the configuration file.
Explanations about Options.-t:
Force pseudo-terminal allocation. This can be used to execute arbitrary screen-
 based programs on a remote machine, which can be very useful, e.g. when implementing
 menu services. Multiple -t options force tty allocation, even if ssh has no local
 tty.
Explanations about Options.-o:
Can be used to give options in the format used in the configuration file. This is
 useful for specifying options for which there is no separate command-line flag. For
 full details of the options listed below, and their possible values, see
 ssh_config(5).
Explanations about Options.-N: Do not execute a remote command. This is useful for just forwarding ports.
